intro: Sisymbrium andinum var. pubescens, commonly known as the Andean rocket, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. Its leaves are hairy and lobed, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. This species is valued for its ecological role and has been studied for its potential in traditional medicine.
